text: You just had it in your fridge
I mean, What the fridge?
- What the fridge?
- ♪ What the Fridge? ♪
[upbeat music]

- Hi, folks.
I'm Seth MacFarlane.

And welcome to the Peacock
"At-Home Variety Show,"

benefitting great organizations
like Americares,

Feeding America,
and United Way--

all of whom
are working very hard

to assist those in need
during this pandemic.

Well, tonight we have
the very funny Amy Poehler,

who starred on the television
show "Parks and Recreation"--

a show about a place
you can't go
and a thing you can't do.

I actually have a great idea
for a show for Amy Poehler.

It's called
"Poehler Opposites."

Get it?
"Poehler Opposites."

It would star her
and John Cena,

and they'd be fighting crime,
I guess.

I don't know.
Amy, you can Venmo me.
Anyway, Amy is one

of the most relentlessly
positive people in comedy,

so let's see how this
quarantine has broken her.

Folks, here is the very funny
Amy Poehler.
- Hi, everyone.

I hope you're staying
safe and sane
during these crazy times.
And if you're like me,

you've been asking
yourself questions

that used to feel like they
were just everyday queries,

and now they're central
to your mental health.

And they include, "Should
I talk to someone today?"
"Should I put on shoes?"

And, "What am I making
for dinner?"

I've been doing a lot of
cooking during the quarantine,

and chopping vegetables has
really helped with my anxiety.
And in that spirit,

we thought
we could have someone on
who knows a lot about cooking.
She won "Top Chef" season 10.

She runs the restaurant
Arlo Grey in Austin, Texas.

And she's the great chef
Kristen Kish.

Hi, Kristen.
- Hello. How are you?

- We are gonna play a little
game to distract ourselves

from the madness
that is going on in the world,

and that game is called
"What the Fridge?"
- ♪ What the Fridge? ♪

- [laughing]
Perfect.

- What the Fridge?
What the Fridge?
- ♪ What the Fridge? ♪

- The way we're gonna play
What the Fridge?--
- ♪ What the Fridge? ♪

- We are going to find someone
in America

who likes to cook at home
but needs a little bit of help.

We're gonna look inside
someone's fridge,

and Kristen is gonna help them
make something amazing
from the stuff that they have.

- Love it.
- Okay.
[laughs] Let's do it!

Lindsay.
- Hi! Oh, my God!

- We're so happy to play
What the Fridge? with you.
- ♪ What the Fridge? ♪

- Yes!
- What the Fridge?
What the Fridge?

We're talking to you from--
is it Gilbert, Arizona?
- It is Gilbert, Arizona.

- Lindsay, what have you been
cooking during quarantine?
- Nothing super awesome.

I'd love to get, you know, back
in the kitchen
and get cranking again.
- Well, we are going to--

and by "we," I mean Kristen--
- [laughs]

- Help you make
an amazing new meal today.

But the first thing
we need to do--

'cause the game is called
What the Fridge?--
- ♪ What the Fridge? ♪

- Is we need to see
what you have in your fridge.

- Okay.
Let's go over there.
I've got eggs,

Beyond Burger
plant-based patties,
unsweetened almond milk,
baby spinach,
sour cream,

some avocados, lemon,
zucchini, bananas.

- Sounds delicious.
- Sounds like a good fridge.

- In the cabinet, I've got
peanut butter and some pasta.

- Now, Lindsay,
you have kids, right?
- I have three boys,

and then my husband
has four kids--
so three girls and a boy.
So we have seven kids combined.

- So I think we need to do
a great pasta dish

so you can make a big batch
for your family.
- Sounds awesome.

- I did not go
to the grocery store.

Literally making variations
off of whatever you have

and whatever I have, which is
not a whole hell of a lot.
So we're gonna make a penne

with a sausage
carbonara-style sauce.

So egg yolks and cream cheese
and olive oil,
some chili flakes.
You're gonna use spinach.

I have arugula that's basically

It's all gonna be in one pan.

So you have
your pasta-cooking water,
and then you have one pan

to actually mix
everything else together.

How much knife work
should we do?

- I don't look pretty doing it,
you know?

Like...
[imitates knife chopping]

[laughs]
but I can cut.

- I want you to take an onion
to get this cooking.

- I don't know

- If you don't have one--
Do you have garlic?

- Ooh, check

You got garlic in there.
- Oh, here's garlic.

- Ooh, all right.
- Perfect. Perfect.
- It's already minced.

shortcuts everywhere.

you're gonna put

using a whisk
when you're stirring it,

you get a fine granular grind
on the meat,

as opposed to, like,
big chunks of meat.
- Oh, okay.

- Now you can turn
your heat on,

because we didn't want

'cause the garlic

- Lindsay, you're a nurse.
Am I right?

to help out there.

- It makes a difference.
It really does.
We love that, so...

Thank you.

- Thank you.

like,
a nice toasty-brown color.

- You can just take it

Same thing.

- That's always a good day.

So maybe, like,
a quarter of a cup.

- Thanks.

- So I see

These are, like,

Like, I mean, you know,

Your pasta's probably about,

So maybe if you want

It feels a little firm.

Thank you so much, Lindsay.

And the best part is that

to raise money

And also, thank you

This was cool.
